column4: can anyone tell me how to install g++ 4.6? there are some dependency errors when I try to install from the 'ubuntu-toolchain-r' repository
oooh, they have a ppa/repo? can i have a link to that?
https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-toolchain-r/
but their gcc is soooo old...
scratch i was looking at wrong row :P
no, i was right. the maverick version more than 3 months old
and failed to compile
yes, but its still 4.6, where does it say failed to compile?
https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-toolchain-r/+archive/test/+packages and expand the gcc-4.6 / maverick entry
I'd rather host my own - of which i was thinking either way
hmm I see.
unless i'd switch to natty. or fedora :P
oh have you built gcc 4.6?
not yet; i was thinking of it, because i didn't know there were packages with it
but since i want to switch to natty soon and they have (seemingly) working versions for natty, i might not have to
hmm, is there any option to get gcc 4.6 in maverick other than compiling it from source?
which isn't going to be a piece of cake i guess
no idea. but compiling from source isn't too bad
then you just do a 'sudo checkinstall' instead of 'sudo make install' and you get nice little .deb :)
but considering how 'high-profile' gcc is, they might provide *proper* debian buld-pkg info that will get you semi-official build
hmm, I am going to try what you and acicula said
now? if so, i might stick around a bit more and if not, then i'm out of here
yes I'm trying now. thanks a lot if you decide to stick around :)
then /msg me
